result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik J Wong was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to restitution for Boston Store (case 14CF994) and Kohl's (case 14CM1469). Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Attend a minimum of 2 self-help meetings per week.

No Contact with any victims or witnesses listed in the criminal complaints. Cases 14CF0994 & 14CM1469 were dismissed and read in. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation in Count 1.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept. To be paid as a condition of probation on Count 1.
Sentence credit of 90 days were granted. Time Served.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment. 
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel meeting on 06/17/2015 or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for non-attendance.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Erik J Wong in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts #1 & 4 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Counts #1 & 4.  Repeater enhancers are struck on both counts.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.   Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 119 days - balance from Count #4)        **CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT #4**
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases 
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Attend a minimum of 2 self-help meetings per week   
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: any victims/witnesses listed in criminal complaints (to include read-in cases)
____Not to operate a motor vehicle without a validn driver's license
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $281.72 to Boston Store on Case #14CF994 (to be paid out of cash bail posted on that case ($200.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)
                          $377.86 to Kohl's on Case #14CM1469 (to be paid out of cash bail posted on that case ($150.00) and remainder due as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
 

COUNT #4:  HUBER:  90 days (209 days credit-remaining credit days to be applied to Count #1) - TIME SERVED

FINE: $1,494.00 (to be as a condition of probation on Count #1)  Court waives the DNA Surcharge based on date of violation.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department (to be as a condition of probation on Count #1) 

DL REVOCATION: 16 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 16 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  6/17/15. Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH
